[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The PDFsam v2.1.0 defines requirements for a free and open-source tool for managing PDF documents, including splitting, merging, and rotating.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PDFsam provides tools for splitting, merging, and modifying PDFs with a user-friendly interface and command-line support.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PDFsam integrates with Java-based utilities and system libraries for PDF processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PDFsam provides a GUI with plugin-based PDF manipulation tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PDFsam supports devices running Windows, Linux, and macOS with Java Runtime Environment.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PDFsam relies on Java Swing for GUI and GNU libraries for core operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Not applicable; PDFsam is a standalone application.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PDFsam requires 254MB RAM, configurable for larger files.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PDFsam runs as a desktop application with no installation dependencies beyond Java.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PDFsam is customizable for batch operations and workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PDFsam does not require external integrations; all processes are local.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PDFsam enables users to split, merge, rotate, and manage PDF files through GUI and CLI.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PDFsam is designed for end-users and administrators managing PDF documents.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PDFsam requires Java Runtime Environment and cannot modify encrypted PDFs without credentials.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PDFsam assumes users have Java 1.6 or higher installed.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: PDFsam: PDF split and merge tool.
GPL: Open-source license ensuring software freedom.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Java libraries for PDF operations.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support file drag-and-drop functionality in the GUI.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to split PDF documents by page ranges.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to merge multiple PDF files (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow rotating specific pages within a PDF (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The GUI shall provide an intuitive layout with drag-and-drop file handling.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall complete split and merge operations within 5 seconds for 100-page files.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall process files up to 500MB without performance degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall log user actions for auditing (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain configuration settings for session restoration.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GNU GPL licensing terms.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall ensure compatibility with major Java-supported operating systems.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 19005-1 PDF/A standards for long-term preservation.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall provide error notifications and log operations for debugging.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and performance testing validate functional requirements.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides and FAQs assist with onboarding and troubleshooting.
[SEC] 5. References: PDFsam documentation, GNU General Public License, and ISO PDF/A standards.
